reviewText: A must for any Jake and the Never Land Pirates fan.  My 3 year old and my 5 year old love this movie and sing along with all of the songs.  We finally ended up getting it on dvd to give us more room on our dvr!  Definitely recommend.

This DVD chronicles the heart-wrenching tale of an antropomorphized pirate ship and the preschoolers he associates with. They solve their problems by Working Together to perform video-game like tasks. This movie was better than Jake & the Never Land Pirates: Peter Pan Returns (Two-Disc DVD + Digital Copy Combo)- the music did not make us as stabby, they did not use the term "codfish" 86 times, and the characters seemed more believeable- I admit to getting a bit sniffly when *spoiler!* Bucky is initially lost to Hook. The movie improves further when dragons and volcanoes are added to the storyline. My son enjoyed that it took place at night. There are eight shorther episodes that follow the same format (Hook steals, the kids do some tasks, get some doubloons, sing a lot, get item back). Ours came with the sword, which was more of a fancy balloon material than a vinyl toy. My three year old said it was "kinda lame." It was squishy and popped easily, but we hid it quickly and things were fine. My son loves this show, so we will continue watching it. I also have a small (and inexplicable) crush on Sharky, the portly pirate.

My kids (3 1/2 year old girl, 2 year old boy) LOVE Jake and the Neverland Pirates. Since they were requesting to watch the one DVD we owned just about ever day, I decided to surprise them and get another DVD when this was on a promotion on Amazon. They quite liked it, but my 3 1/2 year old daughter got very emotional while watching this. The plotline for this movie is that Captain Hook tricks Jake and his friends and as a result takes Bucky, their ship, who is their best friend. Jake and his friends get very upset, and sing a song about losing their best friend - which caused my daughter to burst into tears and get very upset (all 4 times she has watched the movie). I don't think this is necessarily a bad thing - as I sort of enjoy crying at sad movies myself, but just something to be aware of. If you plan to pop this in the DVD player and then run to the other room and make dinner, your kid may burst into tears while you're in the kitchen...

Actually, Bucky is an animated ship and does not talk, much less bark in astonishing code language, but the truth is that Bucky is taken by Captain Hook from Jake and the Never Land Pirates in the new DVD, Jake Saves Bucky. It's especially notable for the re-appearance of Peter Pan to help in the rescue. This is a three-segment story edited together as a "Full Length Adventure."

Rounding out the DVD disc are eight segments, two of which make up a standard Disney Junior half hour show:

-  Peter's Musical Pipes
- The Never Night Star
- Captain Hook's Hooks
- Mr Smee's Pet
- Race Around Rock!
- Captain Hook is Missing! (he's not in the well, either)
- Captain Hook's Lagoon
- Undersea Bucky

Designed for the preschooler, Jake and the Never Land Pirates is much like Mickey Mouse Clubhouse and Dora the Explorer, as the characters often ask the viewers to help out, and in this case, earn onscreen coins as rewards.

Each story is very musical and is followed by a live action pirate duo named "Bones and Sharky" singing an original song over the credits.

Modern Family fans take note: the voice of the mermaid in the last episode, "Undersea Bucky!", is Ariel Winter, who plays Alex Dunphy on the award winning TV sitcom (which is really not for preschoolers).

The new DVD also includes a digital download copy so you can load it onto a portable device to keep the kids amused on the go. Select DVD packages might also include an inflatable play sword.

Purchased this and other "Jake" items because my two and one-half year old grandson loves them.  I love them because they are sturdy and have lasted and survived through all.  This one is being held for Christmas and I know he'll love the surprise.

My kids have really come to like this series. Not only does it have great music, but the stories are fun and lively too. From a parent's perspective, I have to say that I love some of the messages that are shared within the series. Underlying messages of friendship and teamwork are things that I always try and have my daughters show in their daily lives, so anything that can reinforce this (without me telling them) is always a good thing in my book. This was a great movie (ans some great episodes as well), and when my kids saw that it was coming out on DVD they hoped that we would get it for our collection. Though I was used to the shorter shows, they did a great job on this movie and the songs are just as good as you find in the regular series as well. I will also put a plug in for the bonus feature on this DVD as your kids will love singing along playing Pirate-oke!

We set sail with Jake and crew.  According to Neverland Pirate Code, Jake and crew must race Bucky against Jolly Roger and Captain Hook.  If Bucky loses, he belongs to Hook.  Hook wins the race, but Jake and crew have a way to rescue Bucky.  With Peter Pan's help, the crew go on an adventure that includes getting past a dragon.  With your child's help, Jake and crew save Bucky.
There are 4 more episodes.  Music, action and fun are in this movie and proves that being a hero is from teamwork, determination, and friends.  Your preschooler will love this movie.
DVD came in excellent condition and my 4 year old loves it and watches it all the time. He was also very happy to see it came with an inflatable sword.
These characters are so cute.  Whoever came up with this group should be proud of themselves!  My grandson (Age 3), loves Jake and the Neverland Pirates.  He watches them over and over.

Jake and The Never Land Pirates: Jake Saves Bucky is a new Disney DVD compilation of four episodes of the popular Disney Junior original animated series inspried by the Disney classic Peter Pan plus a new full-length feature. In this DVD, Jake, Izzy, Cubby and Skully are learned that, according to the Never Land Pirate Code, Bucky, their enchanted pirate ship must race against the Jolly Roger, and if Bucky loses, it will be the property of Capt. James Hook and his crew. And when Hook cheated to win Bucky, the Never Land Pirates gets help from Peter Pan and they are on the mission to rescue Bucky from Hook. Also in the DVD are four pre-aired episodes of Jake and The Never Land Pirates, including Jake and his crew helps out Marrina the Mermaid save Neptune City. The special features includes a Pirate-oke with Sharky and Bones, Capt. Hook's musical pirate henchmen, as well as sneak peeks of other Disney favourites like the Peter Pan DVD re-release, Tinker Bell and The Secret Of the Wings, and Sofia The First. Jake Saves Bucky is the most coolest Disney Junior DVD up to date!

Yep, ever since the debut of the series, my 5-year old can't get enough of Jake.  The episodes all feature essentially the same story line.  The bumbling Captain Hook is always scheming to steal something that belongs to Jake and his pals, but never succeeds.  Throughout their adventures, the kids have to overcome 3-4 problems or challenges, and earn gold doubloons for their efforts.  In this episode, Captain Hook tries to hoodwink the kids into losing their ship, Bucky.  Each episode is about 12 minutes long, and there are multiple episodes on each disk.

My youngest really loves the storyline and characters. They teach great lessons and how to help others. It is a really great movie and very engaging. He watches it over and over again and then acts out the movie. Love it!

My three-year-old grandson loves watching Jake and the Neverland Pirates at my house but doesn't have satellite television at home, so I was really happy to find this DVD on Amazon. His parents don't have to worry about violence, because the Jake series is geared toward toddlers and preschoolers and is very innocent. It's very sweet with a positive message.
